|brand = OvisLink |model = N.MINI |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N300 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = travel router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = MQ4WAP5502 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8196C; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Lexra |cpu1_type_rev = RLX4181 |cpu1spd = 390 |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L3235DM2I-12G; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9812G6JH-6; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:4F:81 |oui = 00:4F:81
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = Linux;2.4.18;rsdk-96c;
|exp_if_types =
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = Dual High-efficiency PWM Step-down DC-DC Converter;BCD Semiconductor;AUR9706A; |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.1.254 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = airlive |defaultssid = N.MINI |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = AboCom |manuf_model = WAP5502 |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 06/30/2010 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192CE; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "M01-P5502-E10" (as well as a date code of '''1215''') is silkscreened on the board in the images below.. indicating this device is an [[AboCom WAP5502]]. :The FCC ID of the WAP5502 has been assigned to this entry.
===Board headers + etc=== *J15 (between RJ45 and power plug) is likely the serial interface. *J11 is likely a 12-pin JTAG header.
The circuit board is prepared for an USB connector.
Tagline infered from [[AboCom WAP5502]]
==Links of Interest== [http://www.airlive.com/product/N.MINI Product page] :[http://fs.airlive.com/manual/AirLive_N.MINI_SpecSheet.pdf Specifications] :[http://fs.airlive.com/manual/AirLive_N.MINI-QIG.pdf Quick Setup Guide] :[http://fs.airlive.com/manual/AirLive_N.MINI_Manual.pdf User's Manual] :[http://www.airlive.com/support/faq/N.MINI FAQ] :[http://fs.airlive.com/faq/How_to_use_N.MINI_to_extend_the_coverage%20of_my_wireless_network.pdf How to use N.MINI to extend the coverage of a wireless network] [http://www.airlive.com/support/firmware/N.MINI Firmware page] :[http://fs.airlive.com/firmware/N.MINI_v74.11.0.2.1e_b13_httpupgrade.rar Firmware v74.11.0.2.1e_b13] :[http://fs.airlive.com/firmware/N.MINI_v74.11.0.2.1e_b10_httpupgrade.zip Firmware v74.11.0.2.1e_b10] :[http://fs.airlive.com/firmware/Airlive_N.MINI_b9_httpupgrade.zip Firmware v74.11.0.2.1e_b9] :[http://fs.airlive.com/firmware/N.MINI_v74.11.0.2.1e_b7.zip Firmware v74.11.0.2.1e_b7] :[http://fs.airlive.com/GPL_Code/OVISLINK_NMINI_GPL.tgz GPL source (40.9MB)] [http://news.softpedia.com/news/How-to-Unbrick-Your-AirLive-N-Mini-Wireless-N-Router-199471.shtml How to unbrick your AirLive N.MINI]
